Inadapté au buy-and-hold long terme sans surveillance

etfs.name: Amundi MSCI World UCITS ETF EUR (C)
etfs.name_fr: Amundi MSCI World UCITS ETF EUR (C)
etfs.underlying_index_description: Large and mid-cap stocks across developed markets worldwide
etfs.ter_notes: Total Expense Ratio. Competitive for global equity exposure. Note: Some sources indicate TER closer to 0.20% for similar Amundi World ETFs; verify current prospectus.
etfs.pea_eligibility_basis: UCITS ETF domiciled in France structured to meet PEA eligibility requirements (75%+ EU exposure through specific construction)
etfs.top_holdings_note: Synthetic replication. Broad diversification across 1,500+ companies in developed markets.
risks: Market risk from global equity exposure
Currency risk (primarily USD exposure despite EUR denomination)
Concentration in US market (70% of index)
No leverage, but still subject to market volatility
risks_fr: Risque de marché lié à exposition actions mondiales
Risque de change (exposition USD majoritaire malgré cotation EUR)
Risque de contrepartie lié à réplication synthétique
Concentration sur marché américain (70% de l'indice)
Risque de concentration sectorielle (technologie 24%)
Pas de levier, mais soumis à volatilité de marché
Risque de liquidité sur positions plus petites
suitable_for: Core portfolio holding for PEA accounts
Moderate to high risk tolerance investors
Retirement savings with long time horizon
Complementary position to balance leveraged ETFs
suitable_for_fr: Investisseurs long terme cherchant diversification mondiale
Position cœur de portefeuille pour comptes PEA
Investisseurs tolérance au risque modérée à élevée
Épargne retraite avec horizon long terme
Position complémentaire pour équilibrer ETF à levier

aggressive_growth.description: Maximum growth potential with high risk
aggressive_growth.notes: Requires active management and high risk tolerance. Not suitable for most investors.

balanced_growth.description: Growth with moderate risk through diversification
balanced_growth.notes: More sustainable for medium-term horizons. WPEA provides stability.

conservative_growth.description: Stable growth with limited leverage exposure
conservative_growth.notes: Suitable for longer time horizons and lower risk tolerance. Leveraged positions as satellite holdings.

core_only.notes: Most suitable for long-term PEA holders (5+ years). Classic buy-and-hold strategy.

holding_period_less_than_5_years.tax_on_gains: PFU 30% (12.8% income tax + 17.2% social charges) OR progressive income tax scale + 17.2% social charges
holding_period_less_than_5_years.notes: Very unfavorable. Avoid withdrawals before 5 years.

holding_period_5_years_or_more.tax_on_gains: 0% income tax + 17.2% social charges on gains only
holding_period_5_years_or_more.withdrawal_consequence: Partial withdrawals allowed without closure. New contributions prohibited after first withdrawal.
holding_period_5_years_or_more.notes: Significant tax advantage. Primary reason to use PEA.

pea_tax_treatment.optimal_strategy: Hold for minimum 5 years to benefit from income tax exemption

accumulating_advantage.description: All three ETFs are accumulating (capitalizing), meaning dividends are automatically reinvested
accumulating_advantage.benefit: No taxable event from dividends while holding. Only taxed on final gains upon withdrawal.
accumulating_advantage.comparison_to_distributing: Distributing ETFs would trigger annual taxation on dividends, reducing compounding effect.

eligibility_checks.action_if_ineligible: Immediate sale required to maintain PEA status

performance_monitoring.frequency: Monthly for WPEA, Weekly for LQQ/CL2

action_triggers: Rebalance if allocation drifts >5% from target
Consider de-risking if drawdown exceeds personal threshold
Review strategy if volatility decay erodes leveraged positions significantly

important_notes: This data is current as of 2025-12-10. Always verify current information before investing.
PEA eligibility can change due to regulatory updates or ETF composition changes.
TER (Total Expense Ratio) is deducted automatically from ETF performance.
Leveraged ETFs (LQQ, CL2) are NOT suitable for passive buy-and-hold without active monitoring.
Currency risk exists despite EUR denomination due to underlying US equity exposure.
Synthetic replication involves counterparty risk - review KIID documents for details.
This is personal reference data, not investment advice. Consult a professional advisor for personalized guidance.
Always read the KIID (Key Investor Information Document) before investing.
Past performance does not predict future results.
You can lose all of your invested capital.
important_notes_fr: Ces données sont à jour au 2025-12-10. Toujours vérifier les informations actuelles avant d'investir.
L'éligibilité au PEA peut changer suite à des mises à jour réglementaires ou des changements de composition des ETF.
Les TER (frais totaux) sont automatiquement déduits de la performance de l'ETF.
Les ETF à levier (LQQ, CL2) ne conviennent PAS à une stratégie buy-and-hold passive sans surveillance active.
Le risque de change existe malgré la cotation en EUR en raison de l'exposition sous-jacente aux actions américaines.
La réplication synthétique implique un risque de contrepartie - consultez les DICI pour les détails.
Ceci est une référence personnelle, pas un conseil en investissement. Consultez un conseiller professionnel pour un accompagnement personnalisé.
Lisez toujours le DICI (Document d'Information Clé pour l'Investisseur) avant d'investir.
Les performances passées ne préjugent pas des résultats futurs.
Vous pouvez perdre la totalité de votre capital investi.
